ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: learned so much about cultural psychology-- how it is present in all stages, including in our methods of studying psychology. I thought a lot more about how culture can be defined in different, unconventional ways. Learned more about how to reflect on a psychology paper and how the topic impacts me. learned how to really consider an empirical study proposal.

It is a nice class that discusses about different topics that are studied in the field of cultural psychology. Since the professor is well-versed in this field, she has a lot of knowledge that she passed on to us.

I gained a lot of knowledge through close reading of papers and productive classroom discussions. In particular, I feel like I was able to choose papers that I was interested in and accumulate insight in topics I was interested in, which prepared me very well for the final paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: maybe include more class activities-- I really liked working with my peers. I do like how lecture time was kept light and most of the time was spent on discussion with peers.

I really liked the seminar structure and feeling very comfortable discussing anything with Professor Gendron. However I wish the structure of the class could have been a bit more varied. Just doing readings and reading responses and then discuss those in class each week got a bit mundane in the end. Maybe have some specific ideas questions than just a reading response? And maybe have more exercises in class than just discussions.

I loved the course structure the way it is. The weekly response papers kept us engaged in the readings and the class discussions never felt like they were too stressful or difficult to engage in. I appreciated Professor Gendron's patience and understanding throughout the course, which appeared in small but meaningful ways such as saving the last 15 minutes for office hours/questions and allowing us to rewrite our first assignment after receiving comments. I also really appreciated the way Professor Gendron would use our response papers to bring us into discussions. It made it easier for me to speak up in class.
The course is very organized and is overall great. The course covers a diverse set of topics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes absolutely. You gain so much insight into how culture is present everywhere, and how our biases are impacting how we study psychology and how we can acknowledge this and make active change. It is well facilitated and one of my favorite classes!
Yes, its a nice psych senior seminar and the professor is lovely.

Yes! I've loved every course that I've taken with Professor Gendron thus far because they are not as stressful to complete and because I leave feeling like I've gained so much knowledge regarding psychology through our close reading of several papers throughout the semester.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. It is very interesting and educational, especially for psychology students.
